title.narrative: OP 3. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN SCHOOLS AND COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: Focus Provinces/ Districts have increased capacity and deliver child friendly, gender-sensitive Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services in schools and communities including Primary Health Institutions, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016 children's health and development will benefit from equitable and sustainable access to, and use of, safe water and basic sanitation, with particular emphasis on reaching rural remote areas

participating-org.narrative: PROVINCIAL EDUCATION SERVICE AND SPORT SAVANNAKHET PROVINCE

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Focus Provinces/ Districts have increased capacity and deliver child friendly, gender-sensitive WASH services in schools andcommunities including Primary Health Institutions

description.narrative: 2 entire districts in Borikhamxay Province declared ODF. 5452 primary school children including 2718 girls in 51 primary schools received hygiene education and practiced daily routine behaviours. 10,318 children including 5145 girls in 102 primary schools have access to and use of gender sensitive latrines equipped with handwashing stations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2017

of population in select communities have access to and use of basic sanitation facilities

actual.value: 2016:97 communities declared ODF in 2016Approximately 83,500 people in 2 provinces live in ODF environment including the 2 entire districts declared ODF.
